revised_title: Observation of the Lunar Eclipse in Canton, October 11, 1772
tldr: John Blake reports on the observation of the lunar eclipse on October 11, 1772, in Canton. The observation was made using a telescope and a small clock, but the accuracy of the observation is uncertain due to the watch being regulated by the sun the day before. The sky was clear, and the eclipse was expected to be denser, but it appeared very thin, and the beginning was not noted.
